# Mandatory Reading - Read First, Every Session

**CRITICAL:** Before starting ANY task in this project, you MUST read these files in this exact order.

## Why These Files Are Mandatory

These files define:
- How to approach all tasks (workflow and steps)
- Quality standards (definition of done criteria)
- Project-specific rules and structure
- What actions are prohibited

**Reading these files is NOT optional. Skip them and you WILL make mistakes.**

---

## The Mandatory Reading List

### Agent Kernel Mandatory Reading
**File:** [docs/system-prompts/mandatory-reading.md](system-prompts/mandatory-reading.md)

This is the authoritative source for mandatory reading requirements. It includes:
- Core workflow (Analyze, Spec, Plan, Approval, Implement & Document)
- Unbreakable rules
- Quality standards (Definition of Done)
- File naming conventions and project structure
- How to handle uncertainties

**Read this first:** [Agent Kernel Mandatory Reading](system-prompts/mandatory-reading.md)

### Project-Specific Standards

- **[Definition of Done](definition-of-done.md)** - Complete quality checklist for this project
- **[Architecture](architecture.md)** - System design and project structure
- **[Workflows](workflows.md)** - Development workflows specific to this project

---

## Quick Reference

**Before starting ANY work:**
1. Read [Agent Kernel Mandatory Reading](system-prompts/mandatory-reading.md)
2. Review [Definition of Done](definition-of-done.md)
3. Check [AGENTS.md](../AGENTS.md) for project-specific rules

**If you're unsure about anything:** Stop and ask for clarification. Do not proceed.
